instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00850: What is 820-00850? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.CD3215: What is CD3215? This is a USB-C muxing chip responsible for USB-C communication with devices such as the laptop charger. The most common issue this chip is involved in is when a Macbook wonâ€™t charge or the charger is stuck at 5v instead of going to 20v..

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
I have an <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00850</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> which has one dead USBC Port. Checked the ports, they are all clean.
All other 3 ports work perfectly. Customer also just worked on the machine, no issues, besides from it not wanting to go to sleep.
I cannot find any corrosion other then some dusty areas, but none of them seem to be around crucial areas.
<CHIP>U3200</CHIP> seems to not work; when i connect charger, nothing shows on USBC Amp meter. (no bootlooping either).

Where can i start?
When i connect to the adjacent port, i get 20v for <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> at <TRANSISTOR>Q3200</TRANSISTOR>.
I have no luck with these devices, so some pointers are more than welcome please:)

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: Check diode mode to ground for CC1/2 pins of corresponding USB port.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: CC1 reads 0.2649 and CC2 reads 0.2650  (both with red probe to ground)

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: OK after checking those points, i reconnected the charger to the port, and it is now taking 5V and .240 Amps... weird.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: LDOs are all there, except BMC 1v1 LDO. Does this mean i need to replace the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP>? It's underfilled, so i'd rather not of course.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: Be aware, 1V1 LDO must appear on the powered port only .

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
yes i understand.
I power the port corresponding to <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, it's taking 5V @ 240amps and all LDOs appear except for the 1v1 LDO.
Is there anything i should check before starting to replace <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>...?

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
As you cannot find any bad reading on chip rails, should change it.
Be sure all surrounding resistors (pages 29/30) and traces are good.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
damn. ok im going to try, the underfilled crap on this board is driving me nuts though. 
I use a Qianli prying tool to remove most of it, but desoldering the chip is darn hard: feels like i'm  ripping off the chip rather than desoldering it gently...
any tips by any chance?

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: OK, just replaced the chip with a new one; now i get 5v on all ports...goddammit

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
So none of USB-C ports work now?
Something got affected by heat, or you may have broken traces.
Also is possible to have bad solders of <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
Yes, before replacing the <CHIP>U3200</CHIP>, it would start on all other 3 ports. Now, all ports are asking 5v and using 0.2 amps.
I'm going to go over the entire thing once more and keep this thread updated.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
The original chip was communicating correctly with SMC, but had a problem communication with the charger.
The recently soldered chip fails the communication with SMC.
This is the reason why SMC do not allow any other port to switch to 20V.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message: OK, so i assume i can try a different <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> or check traces to SMC firstly.?

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
Not only to SMC.
God knows which other trace may blcok <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> chip from working good.

Be sure all surrounding components are in place and in good condition.

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
alright, it's fixed, i swapped the <CHIP>CD3215</CHIP> with one i reballed (i used new preballed ones, but apparently they never work as opposed to the ones i get from donors)
and the Mac works fine again.
Thanks for the support!

threads.title: 00850 with one port dead
threads.message:
If anyone has good tips on how to remove underfill: more than welcome. I watched Tim Herman's video (you're great at that stuff dude) but somehow my underfill-removal always ends up fucking messy. 
do you guys use heat while removing the underfill? what tools?
